name: Best Vegan Banana Bread
description: This is my favorite vegan banana bread recipe ever, and it's so easy to make in 1 bowl, no mixer required! It's super moist, tender and full of buttery banana flavor. Gluten free, nut free and oil free options.

video.name: Easy Vegan Banana Bread
video.description: This is the best vegan banana bread recipe ever, and it’s so easy to make! The classic loaf is made in 1 bowl with simple ingredients. This is the only banana bread recipe you will need!

recipeIngredient: 2  large ripe bananas, about 1 cup mashed
1/3 cup melted vegan butter  ((see Notes for options))
2/3 cup granulated sugar (or brown sugar, lightly packed)
2 cups all purpose flour ((see Notes for options))
1/4 teaspoon fresh ground nutmeg, optional but good
3/4 cup chopped walnuts or non-dairy chocolate chips, optional

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and grease a standard loaf pan (8 1/2 x 4 1/2 inches or 9 x 5 inches).
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and grease a standard loaf pan (8 1/2 x 4 1/2 inches or 9 x 5 inches).

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the ground flaxseed and water. Set aside to thicken; this is your flax egg mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine the ground flaxseed and water. Set aside to thicken; this is your flax egg mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork until smooth. Scoop it into a measuring cup to make sure you have about 1 cup mashed, then return it to the bowl. Stir the melted vegan butter into the bananas.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork until smooth. Scoop it into a measuring cup to make sure you have about 1 cup mashed, then return it to the bowl. Stir the melted vegan butter into the bananas.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the sugar, almond milk and flax egg mixture. Stir with a large spoon until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the sugar, almond milk and flax egg mixture. Stir with a large spoon until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flour to the bowl with the wet ingredients, then sprinkle the baking soda, salt and nutmeg if using on top of the flour. Stir gently until just combined, making sure you don't over mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flour to the bowl with the wet ingredients, then sprinkle the baking soda, salt and nutmeg if using on top of the flour. Stir gently until just combined, making sure you don't over mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Gently fold in the walnuts or chocolate chips, if using. Pour into the prepared pan, place in the center rack of the oven and bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently fold in the walnuts or chocolate chips, if using. Pour into the prepared pan, place in the center rack of the oven and bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Let it cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer the loaf to a cooling rack. Let the banana bread cool for at least 30 minutes if possible, as this will make it easier to slice. Serve and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Let it cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer the loaf to a cooling rack. Let the banana bread cool for at least 30 minutes if possible, as this will make it easier to slice. Serve and enjoy!

keywords: banana bread recipe, dairy free banana bread, vegan banana bread
